## CO~2~ emissions {#emissions}

```{r compare_emissions, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}
# Data from CDIAC hsitorical emissions by nation 1751-2014
names <- read_csv(file.path(data_dir, "ghg_emissions", "cdiac", 
                            "nation.1751_2014.csv"), 
                  col_names = FALSE, n_max = 1) %>% 
  str_replace_all(c("^Total CO2.*$" = "total", "Emissions from " = "", 
                    "Per capita CO2.*$" = "per-capita", " consumption" = "", 
                    "\\(.*\\)" = "")) %>% 
  str_trim()

emissions <- read_csv(file.path(data_dir, "ghg_emissions", "cdiac", 
                                "nation.1751_2014.csv"), 
                      col_names = simplify(names), skip = 4, 
                      na = c("NA", "", ".")) %>% 
  clean_names() %>%
  mutate(nation = str_to_title(nation) %>% 
           str_replace_all(c(" Of " = " of ", " And " = " and ", " The " = " the ",
                             " *\\(.*\\)" = "", 
                             "Republic of Korea" = "South Korea",
                             "Russian Federation" = "Russia", 
                             "United States of America" = "USA",
                             "Islamic Republic of +" = "")) %>% 
           str_trim(),
         total = total * (44 / 12) * 1E-6,
         per_capita = per_capita * (44 / 12))

end_year <- max(emissions$year, na.rm = T)
start_year <- min(emissions$year, na.rm = T)
year_range <- str_c(start_year, "-", end_year)

eu_members <- c("Austria", "Belgium", "Bulgaria", "Croatia", "Cyprus",
                "Czech Republic", "Czechoslovakia", "Denmark", "Estonia",
                "Finland", "France", "Germany", 
                "Former German Democratic Republic", 
                "Federal Republic of Germany", 
                "Greece", "Hungary", "Ireland", "Italy", "Latvia", "Lithuania",
                "Luxembourg", "Malta", "Netherlands", "Poland", "Portugal",
                "Romania", "Slovakia", "Slovenia", "Spain", "Sweden", 
                "United Kingdom")

recent_emissions <- emissions %>% filter(year == end_year) %>%
  select(nation, total, per_capita) %>%
  mutate(nation = ifelse(nation %in% eu_members, "EU", nation)) %>%
  group_by(nation) %>% summarize_all(funs(sum(., na.rm = T))) %>%
  ungroup() %>% 
  mutate(per_capita = ifelse(nation == "EU", total / 0.511, per_capita)) %>%
  arrange(desc(total)) %>% head(10)

top_10 <- recent_emissions$nation

recent_emissions <- recent_emissions %>% 
  gather(-nation, key = variable, value = emissions)

cum_emissions <- emissions %>% 
  mutate(nation = ifelse(nation %in% eu_members, "EU", nation)) %>%
  filter(nation %in% top_10) %>%
  group_by(nation) %>% 
  summarize(emissions = sum(total), variable = year_range) %>%
  ungroup()

new_vars <- set_names(c(as.character(end_year), 
                        year_range,
                        str_c("Per person, ", end_year)),
                      c("total", year_range, "per_capita")) %>%
  ordered(., levels = .)

compare_emissions <- recent_emissions %>% bind_rows(cum_emissions) %>%
  mutate(variable = new_vars[variable],
         nation = ordered(nation, levels = rev(top_10))) %>%
  arrange(variable, nation)

ggplot(compare_emissions, aes(x = emissions, y = nation)) +
  geom_colh(color = "orange3", fill = "orange3") +
  facet_wrap(~variable, scales = "free_x") +
  labs(x = expression(paste(CO[2], 
                            " emissions (billion tons, or tons per person)")), 
       y = NULL, title = "Three different ways to compare emissions")

```
